meanings.definition: Living in one place for part of the year and moving to another place for the rest of the year.
meanings.sent1: The semisedentary tribe set up camp near the river during the warmer months.
meanings.sent2: The semisedentary lifestyle of the villagers allowed them to cultivate crops in the summer and hunt in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The semisedentary family joked that their house had wheels for the winter migration.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were semisedentary, lingering in one place before moving on to new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The concept of semisedentary living stuck with him, alternating between two homes each year.

meanings.definition: Describing a lifestyle that involves both settled and nomadic elements.
meanings.sent1: The semisedentary community combined the stability of a permanent settlement with the freedom of seasonal migrations.
meanings.sent2: Their semisedentary habits meant they could enjoy the comforts of home while still exploring new territories.
meanings.sent3: The semisedentary travelers carried their homes on their backs, a tent for the night and a house for the day.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a semisedentary wanderer, seeking new experiences while cherishing familiar surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a semisedentary existence, with houses on wheels and people walking between two worlds.
